events.originalText: Aeroflot Flight 1492 was struck by lightning after leaving Moscow's Sheremetyevo International Airport and caught fire during the subsequent emergency landing attempt, killing 41 people on board.
events.subtitle: Aeroflot Flight 1492
events.headline: Aeroflot Flight 1492 struck by lightning and catches fire, killing 41

events.originalText: Kenya Airways Flight 507 crashed immediately after takeoff from Douala International Airport in Cameroon, resulting in the deaths of all 114 people aboard.
events.subtitle: Kenya Airways Flight 507
events.headline: Kenya Airways Flight 507 crashes after takeoff, 114 dead

events.originalText: American teenager Michael P. Fay was caned in Singapore for theft and vandalism, a punishment that the United States deemed to be excessive for a teenager committing a non-violent crime.
events.subtitle: Caning of Michael Fay
events.headline: American teenager caned in Singapore for theft and vandalism

events.originalText: The Twenty-seventh Amendment to the United States Constitution was ratified, 202 years after it was first proposed.
events.subtitle: Twenty-seventh Amendment to the United States Constitution
events.headline: Twenty-seventh Amendment to US Constitution ratified after 202 years

events.originalText: Riots broke out in Washington, D.C., after a rookie police officer shot a Salvadoran man in the chest.
events.subtitle: 1991 Washington, D.C., riot
events.headline: Riots in Washington, D.C. after police officer shoots Salvadoran man

events.originalText: After a 66-day hunger strike, Irish republican Bobby Sands died of starvation in HM Prison Maze.
events.subtitle: 1981 Irish hunger strike
events.headline: Irish republican Bobby Sands dies after 66-day hunger strike

events.originalText: The British Special Air Service recaptured the Iranian embassy in London after a six-day siege by Iranian Arab separatists.
events.subtitle: Special Air Service
events.headline: British SAS recaptures Iranian embassy in London after siege

events.originalText: Project Mercury: American astronaut Alan Shepard (pictured) made a sub-orbital spaceflight on board Freedom 7, becoming the second person to travel into outer space.
events.subtitle: Project Mercury
events.headline: American astronaut Alan Shepard makes sub-orbital spaceflight

events.originalText: The Netherlands Carillon was inaugurated in Arlington, Virginia, on the 15th anniversary of Dutch Liberation Day.
events.subtitle: Netherlands Carillon
events.headline: Netherlands Carillon inaugurated in Arlington, Virginia

events.originalText: World War II: American and German troops fought side-by-side at the Battle for Castle Itter, defending a prison against Waffen-SS forces.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: American and German troops fight side-by-side at Battle for Castle Itter

events.originalText: World War II: The citizens of Prague spontaneously rose up against the city's German occupiers.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Prague citizens rise up against German occupiers in WWII

events.originalText: World War II: A squad of 250 Norwegian volunteers defending Hegra Fortress surrendered to a superior Nazi force after a 25-day siege.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Norwegian volunteers defending Hegra Fortress surrender to Nazis

events.originalText: Pitching for the Boston Americans, Cy Young threw the first perfect game in modern professional baseball.
events.subtitle: Pitcher
events.headline: Cy Young throws first perfect game in modern professional baseball

events.originalText: Carnegie Hall (interior pictured) in New York City, built by the philanthropist Andrew Carnegie, officially opened with a concert conducted by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky.
events.subtitle: Carnegie Hall
events.headline: Carnegie Hall officially opens in New York City with Tchaikovsky concert

events.originalText: American Civil War: Union Lt. Gen. Ulysses S. Grant's Overland Campaign in Virginia began with the inconclusive Battle of the Wilderness (pictured) in Spotsylvania County.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union Gen. Grant's Overland Campaign begins with Battle of the Wilderness

events.originalText: Led by Italian general Giuseppe Garibaldi, the volunteer Expedition of the Thousand set sail from Genoa on a campaign to conquer the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies.
events.subtitle: Giuseppe Garibaldi
events.headline: Expedition of the Thousand sets sail to conquer Kingdom of Two Sicilies

events.originalText: Cromwell's Act of Grace, which pardoned the people of Scotland for any crimes committed during the Wars of the Three Kingdoms, was proclaimed in Edinburgh.
events.subtitle: Cromwell's Act of Grace
events.headline: Cromwell's Act of Grace pardons Scotland for crimes during Wars of Three Kingdoms

events.originalText: First English Civil War: Charles I surrendered himself to Scottish Covenanter leader David Leslie near Newark, England.
events.subtitle: First English Civil War
events.headline: Charles I surrenders to Scottish Covenanter leader near Newark
